channel.title: Lambda Windows 7 Logo At Bottom Of Login screen
channel.description:
so as your probanly know, there is a windows logo at the bottom of your windows 7 logon screen, saying "Windows 7 Ultimate" or "Windows 7 Home Premium" and next to that is a windows logo. Well i found a way to modify that windows logo. so instead of this boring windows logo there, i put a Half-Life 2 logo, its still in the shape of a windows logo, but it looks cool, none the less
to change it go to, X:windows/branding/basebrd/basebrd.dll and replace it with the given one
it will look like
[img]https://img689.imageshack.us/img689/473/fgafdsg.png[/img]
[img]https://img444.imageshack.us/img444/4994/testll.png[/img]
anyways heres the link
[url]https://www.sendspace.com/file/7x27js[/url]

item.title: Lambda Windows 7 Logo At Bottom Of Login screen
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
It all goes back to the inherent and basic distrust that this forum feels regarding downloading and installing stuff based on what is offered in said forum.

It was just the other day that someone suggested to deleted the system32 file.

Yes… that explains a lot.

Read full topic

item.description:

Wohoo you mean there’s one in this thread??!! It’s my lucky day!

item.title: Lambda Windows 7 Logo At Bottom Of Login screen
item.dc:creator: SwampFox56
item.description:
Cameron :smiley: :

Worked fine how? Killed your computer?

no worked fine as in, i had to do a system restore, then worked out all of the bugs, and now its the same as the original, except for the modified bitmap inside of the dll

russilker:

Didn’t you quit the forums?

this

SwampFox56:

From now on, the only reason why i will post here is because i saw something interesting, or to show something off

and i tested the modified dll, and it works fine :meh:
